main event: A UFO sighting report on March 18, 1952 in Alexandria, VA, involving a single aluminum or gilding foil object traveling horizontally for 15-20 seconds, with no other reports in the area and insufficient data for analysis.
interesting points: The object was described as aluminum or gilding foil, rolling, with no tail or spin and no sound.
It appeared to be a single object traveling horizontally for a brief duration.
The report mentioned a 'V' shaped formation of six objects, with two forming the apex and the others forming the legs of the 'V'.
The UFOs were observed gliding slowly over Washington National Airport at an estimated altitude of 6,000 feet.
Only one person reported the sighting, preventing any confirmation from other sources.
